channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2024050738
item.description:
Report X-2024050738

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-21T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATLEY ONE KILOGRAM OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING FOOD PRODUCTS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. OUTER BOX IS PREPRINTED PROPAK, PERISHABLE, RUSH, INSULATED, AND HAS ORIENTATION ARROWS. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM MISSOURI USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 81FY28, REINHART SPRINGFIELD DIVISION, 1620 N PACKER RD, SPRINGFIELD MO 65803-5271.

item.title: Report X-2024050717
item.description:
Report X-2024050717

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-21T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-04
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD C THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING. THE UNLOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE LIDS ON EACH ONE OF THE INNER 2.5 GALLON PLASTIC CONTAINERS WERE LOOSE BY 1/4 OF A TURN AND 4 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS NO INNER PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX.

item.title: Report E-2024050281
item.description:
Report E-2024050281

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-06
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 6, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of pine oil was punctured by a faulty skid and released approximately one-quarter (0.25) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ Environmental (ES+) to remediate the impacted site. ES+ personnel deployed degreaser to the UN1272-impacted trailer and placed absorbent pads to the affected area. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged product was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon drum
